Reviews.Title: “spring break”
Reviews.Author: carol b
Reviews.Content: Agreeing with other reviews of this hotel, we stayed as a family for 3 nights recently.Fantastic location. great room (which was one of only a few in this price range that could do a triple room)Suprised and delighted that ours came with a large walk in shower, and a safe in the wardrobe as well, and was exceptionally clean and well presented. Raul on the front desk was lovely and really helpful whenever we approached him for information.Best side of town as far as we were concerned and within walking distance of Bari Gothic quarter. Would have no hesitation recomending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Forget the other reviews...”
Reviews.Author: xCobyx
Reviews.Content: I'll keep it short. For a 2*, Hotel Oasis is brilliant. My partner and I stayed for 5 days recently and couldn't be happier. The room was ideal for a base, clean and tidy. The reception staff were always happy to help and, contrary to what other travellers here say, the gentleman with the shaved head is actually pleasant, just has a sharp nature. We enjoyed a laugh with him frequently as well as with the other staff. Breakfast is good if you have it included in price and all the travel links around you are easy to use. Metro and Bus stations within a minutes walk. Plenty of restaurants and with Las Ramblas only 10-15 minutes away, I can't recommend Hotel Oasis enough for a stay in Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “A CANNY SCOTS WOMAN”
Reviews.Author: triggerdunoon
Reviews.Content: We paid extra for a Superior Room and it was well worth it. The Bedroom & Bathroom were excellent & very clean & tidy; plus it had a free room safe. It is ideally situated, very central to all attractions; plus a few minutes walk to Metro/Rail/Open Top Bus. Breakfast was adequate but the lady & gent working there were dismal. We were on a side St. with a balcony and although there was traffic noise (natural for a City) because we did so much sightseeing we had no trouble getting to sleep ! BEWARE @ AIRPORT - We had our Personal Carry on Bag stolen ! I'd gone to the toilet & my bag was under the Cafe table, on top of my Husbands feet, a lady tapped him on the shoulder & it simply disappeared !! Police are far from helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence in Service, Strategic Location, & Spacious Room”
Reviews.Author: Tasadays
Reviews.Content: Oasis Hotel have us a very pleasant surprise. Our vacation in Barcelona was made more enjoyable due to the accommodating attitude of the front desk staffs. Raul, Lino (others I forgot) gave us tips on where to eat delicious paella at reasonable price  The location is also very stratrategic as it is close to the boulevard, Las Rambla, etc As tip to those who will use the Metro, it is 30mtrs away from the Barceloneta exit. When you exit the Barceloneta station turn left & it's 30mtrs away

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Terrible Nights Sleep”
Reviews.Author: alanjackson10
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner just came back from a weekend in Barcelona staying at Hotel Oasis. 1st thoughts; looks nice enough from the front and lobby area, we were then greeted by a shaven headed miserable chap. He gave us our room key and when I asked if the room had a safe he sighed and gave us a different room. When we walked to our room we realised he tried to put us in a basic room even though we had paid for a superior room. The room was very nice but very small, this didn’t bother us as we weren’t planning on spending much time in there. The shower area is fab, two shower heads and really powerful. We were very happy with the hotel and room we had eventually been given. We left the hotel and found our location to be absolutely perfect, 1 min from the metro, 15 mins walk to the Rambla and plenty of good local bars and restaurants. Then comes the downfall, after a long 1st day sight seeing, eating and drinking sangria we decided to hit the sack. Bed very uncomfortable, every time one of us moved the bed rattled and moved (a lot), the pillows were so wafer thin. I think I had about 9 hours sleep in 3 nights. I came home from this vacation totally shattered. Get some decent beds and get rid of the miserable chap on reception (the rest were absolutely fine!) and you have your self a cracking hotel. All in all a great holiday, just a shame about these couple of points, my advise would be to get a twin room and push beds together so you can get some sleep when you need to.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for your money!”
Reviews.Author: Takemeaway28
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights in Hotel Oasis and were very pleased with the location. Within a walking distance there is many attractions like harbor, Ramblas, beach, Parc de la Ciutadella, many museums ect. You are able to explorer idyllic blocks of Barri Gotic and El Borne by foot. It’s also just a step away from Barceloneta metro station for easy access to other parts of the city. Location is very convenient considering airport transfers as well. We couldn’t be more happy with the location! Our room was placed in the old part of the building and the window was facing on back yard so not anything you could call a view, but we didn’t mind. The room was a bit out dated and basic but still nice and tidy. We are not spending too much time in hotel room in our trips so basic room is not an issue for us as long as it’s clean and functional. But we saw really fancy rooms there as well, so ask for those if you are looking something more sophisticated. Service was excellent and friendly. Breakfast was not included in room rate, but that’s just fine. There are plenty of places serving breakfast in the neighborhood (as long as you are not fancying very early breakfast). We tried the hotel breakfast as well and it was fine start for your day. Nothing spectacular but ok for that price. I strongly recommend Hotel Oasis everyone looking for nice and clear rooms with outstanding location. Hotel Oasis must be the best your money can buy in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “amazing stay!”
Reviews.Author: Leanne M
Reviews.Content: Very close to the ramblas! Easy to get to from the airport and close access to the metro and bus tours! Stayed here for 2 nights and the room was fantastic! It was a refurbished room and was better quality than some of the 4 star hotels I have stayed in. Didn't include breakfast but being in the heart of the city we didn't want to stay in and enjoyed eating out! Made my boyfriends 21st extra special! Want to go back! Can't recommend it highly enough!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: GauravCreations
Reviews.Content: This hotel is at a perfect location. It is very very close to the train station and to the beach as well. The hotel is decent and the rooms are clean. We were a group of 4 friends and had booked 2 twin rooms for 1 night. I would say it is the perfect place to stay when you want an excellent location on a budget. You may read about my trip to Barcelona at http://www.cafeinks.com/archives/1219/barcelona-gaudi-gaudi-everywhere

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us!”
Reviews.Author: NeevyB
Reviews.Content: My friend and I booked a twin room for two nights in the Oasis hotel for 50 euro each. We decided not to book breakfast as we would be arriving Friday afternoon and leaving too early on Sunday morning to make use of it. Upon arrival we met Raul who was friendly and welcoming not to mention hilarious! We were staying in room 206 and were very happy with it. It was on the small side but, for the price and the fact that we were only using the room as a base, this didn't matter to us and we were very happy with it. It was spotless and the bathroom was lovely containing a shower with two heads and great pressure although you will need to bring shampoo and soap as there wasn't much supplied. The location is perfect with the metro two minutes walk away or a short stroll to La Rambla and the Born district. We needed to leave the hotel at 5.30am Sunday morning to catch our flight so the night manager booked a taxi for us and rang our room when it arrived. Overall, I think it depends on what you are expecting whether or not you're happy with your stay. For us, it was perfect and I would happily recommend it as the ideal base for your stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent 2 star hotel, bad experience”
Reviews.Author: mgreg
Reviews.Content: We`ve booked 3 months in advance and by the time we arrived in the airport to take the flight to BCN it was delayed. We`ve called the hotel to announce late check in, they found our reservations and told us everything was ok. By the time we arrived in hotel, things have changed. There were no rooms available, he said, the receptionist, but he sorted it out with a special offer, an excellent 3 star hotel, 2 blocks away. When we arrived in the new hotel, it was the ugliest 2 star hotel, with the smallest rooms and bathrooms. And, Of course, the poorest breakfast. Next morning we`ve called the travel agency who booked for us, and after one more day in Santa Marta Hotel, they managed to move us back to Oasis. Well, Oasis is an excellent 2 star hotel. Maybe a good 3 star hotel. Large and clean rooms, nice bathrooms, nice staff ( with one exception!) close to main attractions, easy access. Very good hotel for the price we`ve paid, but I wouldn`t book again, to arrive in that Santa Marta hotel. They have to manage somehow that, I know it was not the first time it happened

Reviews.Title: “Great little budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lee V
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from a 3 night stay at the Oasis Hotel and having seen the varying comments on the hotel, this review will be as honest as can be. The booking was made via Footballbreak.co.uk as part of a package deal for my two brothers and I to go and see Barcelona play. With flights, a match ticket and 3 nights at the Oasis the whole package came to £292.00 per person ( excluding transfers). An absolute bargain. However, the trip couldn't have got off to the worst start. Upon arriving at the hotel and being given our ticket envelope, you can imagine my horror at seeing the tickets were for a completely different game next year!!! Whilst this had nothing to do with the hotel, the receptionist on duty Raul was absolutely superb. He called the Spanish agency emergency number and explained the problem and luckily enough he found out that Footballbreak had noted their error before we had arrived and had actually couriered the correct tickets. Checking in to our room we found three single beds as we had requested, a small wardrobe, small plasma screen TV and average sized bathroom with a bath and shower. The room did look dated, lots of scuff marks on the wall, the hairdryer was hanging off the wall but overall it was as we expected for a 2 star hotel. The room was cleaned every day which sometimes you do not get in more star hotels who will only do it once every other day. The one thing I would mention though is the occasional smell of sewage which does come up from the streets and into the hotel rooms. Not sure if this is a hotel problem or just the particular street the hotel is on. We paid for the hotel wifi at 3 euros per day, the connection can fluctuate a bit but for 3 euros again you cant complain really. The shining light of the hotel though is its location. 10 minutes walk to Las Ramblas, 2 minute walk to the metro, five minute walk to the harbour and supermarkets dotted around the area. The night life was still pretty busy even for November but does not kick start until at least 12pm- 1am. Overall for our first trip to Barcelona, we couldnt fault the hotel. The staff were polite enough and there were guests from all over the world staying there which added to a nice cosmopolitan feel to it. If we were looking to do things on a budget again then we would have no hesitation staying there and again special thanks to Raul.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a short break”
Reviews.Author: Gasman295
Reviews.Content: The rooms are quite small with only a wardrobe to keep your clothes , no draws. You do get a small safe in the wardrobe(free) which came in handy for our passports money etc. The bed was clean but a little uncomfortable.The TV only has 3 English channels 2 business and BBC news.The rest are Spanish. The bathroom has a large shower cubicle with powerful shower and was very clean. We had room 106 which is above the bar which closed about 10.30-11 pm but you do get road noise . Breakfast consisted of cerials toast, meats, cheese, breads, and scrambled eggs along with coffee and tea. Staff are pleasant and helpful. The bar attached to the hotel does some tapas and other food at reasonable prices and drinks are also reasonably priced. The location is very close to the Born district as well as Barcelonetta and the port. The Ramblas is a 20 min walk . Over all we had a good time and enjoyed the location, my best tip is if you are flying from BCN El Pratt get the train to the airport, the station is only a 3 min walk from the hotel and is cheaper than the aerobus you change at Pas De Gracia but this is very easy as you get off the train and then wait for the second train on the same platform.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Suzy1284
Reviews.Content: Oasis Hotel offers amazing rooms of very convenient size, super clean and great helpful staff. The hotel is 2 minutes walk from a bus and a metro station. Its is also a short walk to the sea and to the Ramblas Street. I would definitely recommended Oasis hotel for average budget travelers for the great value you get in return for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for the price you pay!”
Reviews.Author: jadeh123
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving here we were abit wary of the hotel rooms and condition(previous bed bug reviews) but as soon as we walked in we found a clean, cheap and good for your money hotel. We paid an extra £30 for the superior rooms which we found to be very clean, modern and the bathroom was great, not the usual drip shower you usually get in hotels, this is a top of the range shower! The rooms were a little on the small side, however they were very clean and very sufficient for a short stay. We only used rooms for sleeping(The beds were very comfortable) and if you do use it as a base for your trip this is an ideal hotel. The location is great if you are taking the tube which i would recommend, and is just outside a bus stop but you can walk to the ramblas and centre in 15/20 mins at a nice pace. You are also very close to the old town and there is plenty of life around the area of the hotel. We didnt use the hotel for food, so cant comment. The staff we found to be abit hit and miss, There were some very polite staff and some very ignorant so would advise for them to be abit more customer friendly as people will complain. All in all i would recommend this hotel for someone looking for a cheap, clean and well located hotel. We would definitley return considering the price we paid. If you are looking for more, then you need to pay more! You get what you pay for. We will return to the hotel and recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good Staff”
Reviews.Author: Rudolf M
Reviews.Content: Perfect location of the hotel, amazing staff, always helpfull, hotel simple, but really nice, room was simle, new furniture, clean and usefull....good bar, with nice staff and good coffee.Raul was superb.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at ALL cost-total Rudeness”
Reviews.Author: Joanne S
Reviews.Content: I gave my honest review on the website I booked through, unfortunately it is very bad, as were many others about it. I booked this hotel as I had stayed there 4 years previously, sadly the hotel has gone down hill, twin rooms TINY, breakfast is a rip off-go next door its cheaper&nicer, front desk staff are the rudest people I've ever come across in a hotel, Hotel Oasis should be embarrassed at their attitude and behaviour. I Do not recommend this hotel. The manager then sent me a grotty gibberish email to my personal email account, completely unprofessional and shameful for whoever hired such a man to "manage" their business - avoid at all cost - see below, appalling! Hello, Incredible comment that has made harm Booking for hotel and staff who work here. I also do not comment seems incredible that they wanted to go without paying the hotel room and who can not read the conditions are very clear on the booking when it does. Thank god that most guests staying at this hotel did not have the same opinion. Please do not come to Spain and more people like you do not know the most important travel and no education for it. Thank you very much and have a happy life far from here and I really mean it. Thank you. Raul Manuel Santos Carrillo. Manager

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Oliviamouse
Reviews.Content: Recently I had my third stay at Hotel Oasis. This time I was going to stay somewhere with nicer rooms, but La Merce was on and so those nicer rooms were either unavailable or ridiculously overpriced. So Hotel Oasis it was, and as on my other stays, the location was unbeatable. Everything on at La Merce was within walking distance, but the hotel itself was an oasis of quiet. I booked a standard room and it was fine, clean, quite spacious and airconditioned. The window was to the indoors and the television reception leaves a lot to be desired, but for the price it's difficult to complain. Oasis is in a fantastic location, the staff are always pleasant and professional, and we were only in the hotel to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “NOT THE SAME AS THE PICS SAY. AND THE STAFF IS TERRIBLE!!”
Reviews.Author: jlondon186338
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal on good ole lastminute.com for a double room, standard. no frills. Fine, i thought. for 80 bucks 2 nights, it was cheaper than actual hostels. the lady who checked me in yesterday in the late afternoon, the 13 Oct, was lovely. The only glitch was the room she gave me was a smoking twin room facing the busy street outside. Not one wink that night! When i went downstairs to get them to move me (asthmatic for starters, bad back for a single bed as well), she told me that I had to come back the following morning to move. Fine. I did exactly just that and was given in the end a (not so much better) double room on the top floor. Nothing to write home about. Peeling wallpaper, bathroom that smelled of pee, enclosed walls that felt too claustrophobic (no windows) and really bad room throughout. It somehow crossed my mind that the lady who checked me in was doing me a favour. But hey - bad back! But what made me really upset was the staff member that just served me an hour ago. Man, of Filipino descent (or so the accent proclaims) and I simply asked for directions to the nearest internet cafe to print out my boarding pass. He proceeded to give me directions to the "Pakistani shop" behind that building (racist much?) and his directions, proclaimed in a very very rude way, couldn´t help a seasoned traveller. I actually had to ask someone else to help me. But by then, I was too upset to even go on. The way that he talked was very unforgiving, like it was such an inconvenience for him to give directions, even though the directions were very unclear to begin with. All in all, I wouldn´t go back to Hotel Oasis again. And I come to Barcelona a fair bit. From what I´ve seen, the most terrible rooms, the staff absolutely lacking in customer service and needs training in this area. Perks is close to the station though so if you can ignore the power tripping of this particular male staff member, then by all means go ahead.

Reviews.Title: “clean and well located”
Reviews.Author: JonsTravels11
Reviews.Content: good location near port and gothic district. the staff was very friendly and attentive. room very small and dark small window faced the inside walls.beds comfortable. price was good,would stay again but make sure they gave me a room with better view.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs-don't go. Superior room 403.”
Reviews.Author: Suntanqueen
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, but unfortunately was bitten on first night. Thought it was mossies as had left balcony door open. However these bites were different, I'm severely allergic to mosquitos and the bites were different. On examining bed next night a little critter was crawling up the counterpane, towards me for supper. I caught it and a dead one. I took it to reception, who arranged to change the room. No apology and not that surprised, not even a free breakfast as compensation. Room 208 appeared to be bug free. No fresh bites. Taking no chances and everything has gone in freezer when we got home. If you go it's your call but acquaint yourself with how to look for bed bugs and take no chances. It's a real shame about this hotel. They have tried to upgrade and improve but the fundamentals of sleeping in a safe secure hotel room just don't make it. At the end of the day the hotel has made a contract to provide this via a booking and it didn't deliver.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Alison1989
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect. 2 minutes away from Barceloneta Metro station,10 min walk from the beach and harbour. The room we got was basic, not like the ones advertised on the website. We could have changed rooms, but decided to just stay in our origional room. Breakfast was quite basic to - cereal, toast, ham, cheese, tomato, lettuce, bread. Staff all lovely and helpful. Would definatley go back as the location was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: donnagriffiths
Reviews.Content: lovely clean great location for sightseeing. Oasis looked like it had just been done up , lovely clean bathroom and comfortable bed and working air conditioning!!! Very helpul reception , spoke excellent english. Buffet style breakfast which really wasnt my cup of tea but was clean and the staff ok.very limited to what you get for the 8 euros price but you can eat as much as you like!!! Rooms were cleaned daily and plenty of room to relax after a tiring day of sight seeing,would highly recommend this hotel especially for the price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: lelei76
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. The bathroom was new and spotless. The rooms were small but comfortable and very clean. The hotel is centrally located on a quiet street between two subway stops. The staff was super-friendly and accommodating. It was a short walk to barceloneta and a quick ride on the metro to every other place. I do not recommend paying for the breakfast here or even at the little connected bar that didn't serve hot food when I was there. However, there is a little cafe on the corner that offers a nice, hot breakfast for a reasonable price, and of course there is all of barcelona and the mercat de la boqueria for fabulous food. I cannot wait until I can return to the Hotel Oasis. I could not believe how reasonable the price was!

Reviews.Title: “On the whole good”
Reviews.Author: Sandy V
Reviews.Content: I spent a week in August 2011 in Barcelona and I chose this hotel because of its position. In fact it's near the city centre, the underground and also the beach of Barceloneta. In particular it's a 10 minute's walk from a part of the beach which isn't crowded as other parts and it's near the port, that is the centre of night life. I was terribly scared about the presence of beetles that some tourists reported in their opinions, but in our room (which was on the 5th floor) there weren't. The room was quite big and clean, on the whole good, a part from the lack of the bath door, which could be a problem. The breakfast buffet was hearty and I can't complain about it. As far as the staff is concerned, some members weren't the top of courtesy, but others were much kinder and helpful, anyway we could deal with all of them. In the end I think I would recommend this hotel, the position is perfect, rooms and food are good and even if there are some faults they don't weaken drastically the quality of the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Handy Location”
Reviews.Author: Sharpeze
Reviews.Content: We had a standard room (4 nights approx NZ $500) & the decor was a little tired. However it was clean had a good shower & the location of the hotel was fabulous. Very near to the Hop on/off bus route and good restaurants. 15 min walk to the beach. 20 + min walk to well know street Le Rambla. Had to pay for very slow Wi fi in our rooms (better speed in the foyer). Breakfast was basic. Friendly staff. Got a taxi to the hotel for 25 Euro from the airport on a Sunday afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and would recommend it to others”
Reviews.Author: Gra_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in the hotel. It was clean, comfortable and quiet. The room itself was basic. The lift was out of order the night we arrived which was a little inconvenient with the bags, but no big deal. It was working for the rest of our stay. It is located very close to a metro station and easy walking distance to the beach, the Rambla and the Gothic area. I would stay there again and would recommend it as good value.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience with Hotel Oasis)-:”
Reviews.Author: CrunchyTeacher
Reviews.Content: I booked Hotel Oasis for the last 2 days of my 2 week vacation in Spain, thinking I was "splurging" to stay in a nice hotel, with wifi, in a great location. When I arrived to check in, the problems started: 1) the desk clerk had no record of my booking and blamed it on a computer problem for May 29-31. 2) He then proceeded to walk me down an alley to another hotel, without explanation and dropped me off. 3) That hotel was much, MUCH shabbier than Hotel Oasis. That desk clerk was not polite or helpful and seemed downright irritated that I was there. When I asked why I was taken to his hotel, he said he didn't know and I would need to ask Hotel Oasis. Then he gave me a bill. I said I had already paid and after arguing about it for a minute, he called Hotel Oasis and got confirmation that I had indeed paid. I asked about wifi and was told there was non in any part of the hotel. Sigh. I went back to Hotel Oasis and asked for an explanation. I was told they were out of rooms and I would need to stay in the other hotel. I left an called the lovely hostel I had just checked out of (thinking I was upgrading) but sadly, they were already booked. I was stuck at the shabby, out of date, dirty, no wiki Hotel Santa Marta. I feel cheated. I paid for Hotel Oasis and chose it specifically because it seemed nice, safe, and had wifi (which I really wanted since I would be traveling alone and needed entertainment an communication). What I ended up with was a back alley hotel that had terrible beds, paper thin walls with noisy guest, and crappy customer service. Oh, and a basket of almost rotting apples on the front desk. Gross! Hotel Oasis was not apologetic or the least bit concerned that I was not happy with the hotel they sent me to. I would most definitely NOT recommend this hotel. Try Somnio Hostels instead. They were WONDERFUL.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for exploring city.”
Reviews.Author: WhiteheadDolphin
Reviews.Content: Good value for money and great location. Comfortable beds and quiet at night.

Reviews.Title: “Coasy, simple, great price-service relation!”
Reviews.Author: CloBar17
Reviews.Content: When I saw on the web it only had 2 stars, I was sort of afrais. However, it was a pleasant surprise when I arrived, cause it is very clean, coasy and perfectly well located. Also, the service personnel were very nice. I really recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful!”
Reviews.Author: skyblueaaron
Reviews.Content: Top location and great service. 10 minute walk from the Ramblas, 10 minutes from the beach and a metro station around the corner. Great hotel for a short break in Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Good value budget hotel in prime location”
Reviews.Author: Mr_and_Mrs_Calli
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently situated for all manner of activities during your stay in Barcelona. It is a budget hotel with few frills- it is important to remember that like most things, you get what you pay for! So, yes the rooms aren't huge but we found ours to be perfectly acceptable for our 4 night stay, it was clean and attended to daily by polite staff. Our room was situated on the side overooking Plaça de Palau which is a pleasant view both day and night. It is a busy area so you can hear traffic noise, but not intrusively so. Breakfast is a straightforward self service affair providing all that you need to set you up for the day.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem of a hotel and a great bargain”
Reviews.Author: Megalah Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: After being wary because The Oasis was not listed in Rick Steves' or Fodor's guide books my husband and I were very pleased with the room, the friendly service, and the overall ambiance. Our cousins in an adjoining room were also pleased. The location is superb, in easy walking distance to La Rambla, the Picasso museum, clothing and food stores, restaurants, the beach and other points of interest. The room was spotlessly clean and made up early each morning. The staff were helpful and always smiling. Nice thick towels--but not much soap or shampoo stuffs. (If you are American--bring your own washcloth.) We were on the first floor (not the ground floor) facing a side street and kept our window open a bit at night. Nice fresh air, but some street noise.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value hotel in a fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: jase87
Reviews.Content: Hotel Oasis is AMAZING! Literally a 5 minute walk from La Rambla and the Barceloneta Beach as well as having a Metro Stop (Barceloneta) about 1 minute's walk from the hotel's front door. Rooms are a good size and we got a recently refurbished bathroom which was gorgeous. Hotel has ajoining bar and cafe and has very friendly staff who are happy to help you find your way to any of the major sights. Highly recommend. we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: soolooSurrey
Reviews.Content: We are just back from our first stay at The Oasis Hotel, Pla de Palau, Barcelona, booked through Octopus Travel after reading the previous reviews. Firstly, let's deal with the issue of the rooms. Yes they are small but perfectly adequate, after all they are only for sleeping in. I've attached some photos of our room and bathroom (which is of greater importance to me than the size of the room). Our room had been renovated to a good standard. The biggest downside for me was the lack of tea/coffee making facilities in the room as we do like to wake up and have tea or coffee to start the day. We didn't book breakfast at the hotel after reading the reviews but we did have breakfast every morning in the small cafe two doors from the hotel entrance, open from 8am. Very friendly staff who guided us to some great little places. The hotel is situated next to Barceloneta Metro stop and there is also a bus stop right outside. Overall, on our experience, the Oasis Hotel is a great budget hotel within easy walking distance of La Rambla, the beach/harbour area and Barri Gotic. I won't go into great detail as other reviewers have already described the location. We did go into the "bar" once before we went out one evening but we didn't feel particularly comfortable there and left quite soon. They do serve tapas but we didn't try it. After all said and done, if we do return to Barcelona, we would not hesitate to stay at the Oasis again. Along the way to La Rambla are a few restaurants, try the Sailor restaurant, the food was excellent and the service even better. We had been out for a very full day's sightseeing and just wanted to stay local. If you want a quiet, (very) relaxed meal this is the place. As for Barcelona in general, I highly recommend the hop on hop off bus. We had a good idea of what we wanted to do and see but decided to include some extra things that we came across on the route(s). Do listen to the commentary as it is very interesting and informative.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel very well located”
Reviews.Author: JPopiel
Reviews.Content: Hotel very well located near metro station. Rooms feature standard, nice bathroom. The downside is the lack of WiFi. Breakfast is monotonous, but you can eat. Well, except for coffee, which is not suitable for drinking.

Reviews.Title: “acceptable for one/two nights”
Reviews.Author: ExpGleiwitz_OS
Reviews.Content: Hotel located near harbour, and beaches (1km) and aquarium. Rooms ok, should be a bit more refurbished/renowanted. Continental breakfest OK, nothing special, a bit small place where they serve it, and sometimes there was a queue to get coffee, etc. Hotel staff very friendly. In hotel, there is also a small bar, but mainly for drinks/snacks, quite smoggy. In general, if you need just to sleep, ang go tsightseeint, this hotel is a good choice. Nothing luxurious, but keeps three stars *** standard. In minus: They did not not offer a baby bed/craddle

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Oasis a perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: RetroC Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: I searched the internet for days then came across the Octopus travel web site. Here I found the Oasis Hotel. This is in a perfect spot, on the edge of the old town and close to the sea. The price was great and we did not expect to get such good service every body was helpful and friendly the room was nice and there was a very good buffet break fast included. We would defiantly book the hotel again if we return to Barcelona, and would recommend it for excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location fantastic little hotel with fabulous staff”
Reviews.Author: BarcelonamadLizzie Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to Barcelona and no hesitation in staying back at The Oasis for it's brilliant location near the beach and the Gothic quarter and Las Ramblas you really are minutes from anywhere the staff were again lovely my room was a big double room great plasma on wall lovely bathroom really trendy would always stay here from now on as it's also so cheap I can't see how it can be beaten the only down side is the breakfasts- in 2009 they had lovely cooked breakfasts but now it's just continental which is a bit of a shame

Reviews.Title: “Great location and the rooms are OK considering the price...but”
Reviews.Author: Aira75
Reviews.Content: Great location and the rooms are OK considering the price...but beware of cleaning ladies who seem to investigate all your luggage. We had some cash hidden very carefully in our suitcase and about 100 EUR was stolen :( However the location of the hotel is perfect, so I would stay there again, only next time I'll certainly use the safe.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable value”
Reviews.Author: Steve-mcr
Reviews.Content: We recently spent two nights at the Hotel Oasis and were very pleased with every aspect of our stay. The hotel is only rated one star but don't let that put you off. It appeared that half the hotel rooms have been renovated and we were lucky enough to get one of these. It was modern, clean and compact with twin beds and a small flatscreen tv on the wall. The bathroom and shower would not have looked out of place in a 4 star hotel. The reception area is nice if a little dated and the staff on reception were friendly and very helpful. There is a little bar attached to the hotel and vending machines near the restaurant area if looking for a late night drink or snack on return from a night out! The location of the hotel is probably the best feature with a metro station no more than a minutes walk away and the Estacio de Franco train station a five minute walk. The gothic quarter (Barri Gotic) is a five minute walk and the Born area of the City just a couple of minutes away. La Ramblas is a 10-15 minutes stroll away in the same direction. In the other direction the Barceloneta area and port is about 5 minutes away and the beach just a bit further. When returning to Barcelona I will definately be looking to stay at this same hotel. At only 50 euros per night for a nice modern twin room in a superbly located hotel in one of the best cities in the world you can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel for cruisers.”
Reviews.Author: cruzanChristiansted
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel prior to our Norwegian cruise. The staff was friendly knowledgeable and very helpful. We do think breakfast should have been included.

Reviews.Title: “have a date at this oasis”
Reviews.Author: oldfeller64
Reviews.Content: If you want a hotel conveinient to station--OASIS.If you want a hotel close to Barcaloneta--OASIS. If you want a hotel next to the Xampla district--OASIS. If you want a hotel 10 mins walk of the Ramblas--OASIS. If you want a hotel professionaly and well run--OASIS. Stayed four nights,30 mins and 3 euros from airport,5 mins walk from Franca station to hotel.Room 512 compact but adequate, bathroom functional,air-con and view through to Port Vell and beyond. Breakfast basic continental with mid range goods but plenty of it. This hotel is ideal for a low budget visit to Barcelona as it is well positioned for all the sights and nightlife,with the tour bus stop 100 metres along the road.For the price paid through Octopus this was a bargain

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Cristina0
Reviews.Content: Hotel Oasis was amazing, more than i expected, considering the price paid and the fact that it is rated 1 start only. Easy to reach, near Barceloneta metro stop, this hotel is perfect for exploring Barcelona. It is more like a 3 star hotel, with the best bathroom i have ever seen in a budget-hotel. The room was very nice decorated, everything looked new. It is the best hotel i have found on booking.com and trust me, i travel a lot. Next time in Barcelona, Oasis for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - cheap but definitely not nasty”
Reviews.Author: Tabascoleathergrain
Reviews.Content: Located within 3 minutes of Barcelonetta metro station, a 10 minue stroll to the beach and on the edge of the Barri Gotic quarter, the Hotel Oasis proved to be excellent value for our party of 6 spanning ages 12 to 86. It provided clean rooms with simple air-conditioning which took away the exteme heat of summer, a reasonable cold buffet breakfast and pleasant staff willing to offer assistance whenever requested. Although it did not affect our sleep, it was close to a major road such that the traffic provided a slight background drone. Given the low cost, however, this was a very minor inconvenience and did nothing to detract from the hotel's overall value in my view.

Reviews.Title: “More than I expected!”
Reviews.Author: Johncook59
Reviews.Content: we booked a triple sized room for the price of a double,..the front desk was very helpful with my many questions,even helped me brake up large euros,gotta say,we stayed there 3 days and were always greeted with a smile and a hello,ola coming and going,wonderful location.!

Reviews.Title: “very uncomfortable...but very cheap option for location”
Reviews.Author: dashboard12
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Oasis one night in April, and decided on the hotel because of the cheap cost:location ratio. Also, it was very last minute, so many other hotels were booked. The room was very small, and did not have a window. It didn't seem like a problem at first, but the AC also did not work, and despite the fact that outside, it was breezy, in the room it was hot and suffocating. I did not sleep well at all through the night, and it was very uncomfortable,. It was not just the heat, but the fact that the air is very stale because the ventilation was very poor. The room and the bathroom were clean. The staff was average (what you would expect). Location was near the metro, which was a plus, but there is some construction around the hotel, and many shops nearby seemed to be closed or have moved away, not sure why. I would not recommend this hotel. However, it is a very cheap option.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but poor accomodations and staff leave something to be desired!”
Reviews.Author: travelinjt
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hotel Oasis was just for one night following a Mediterranean cruise. We had stayed at the Tryp Apolo in Barcelona prior to our cruise embarkment and really enjoyed the accomodations there! (Very much what we are used to in the States!) So we were expecting similar accomodations at Hotel Oasis, given they are at similar price-points. However, we were sadly disappointed. Not only was Raoul, the front deskman, lacking personalilty, he couldn't even bring himself to smile upon our check-in. And if we had a question, we felt as if we were putting him out. (Another evening staff member, Narcis, was quite polite, but didn't follow-through with things as we had to come downstairs twice to get an extra pillow and he failed to notify the morning staff of our request for a wake-up call, which almost caused us to miss our morning flight back to New York! Additionally, our taxi was never arranged as he assured it would be. The morning desk woman was, however, very attentive to our needs and did a fine job arranging for a taxi to pick us up and take us to the airport the morning of our check-out.) Our room was spacious for our family of four (parents with two teenagers), but definitely not comfortable with four twin-sized beds, a cold tile floor, a teeny-tiny cheaply renovated bathroom, and a noisy street outside. Granted, the hotel staff cannot help the traffic noise, nor could they help that construction was being done right in front of their hotel, but they could have at least pushed two of the twin beds together for my husband and I and provided enough towels for the four of us to shower. There were no instructions on the plastic telephone in the room on how to reach the front desk (or anywhere else in the hotel), so if you needed anything you had to leave your room, walk downstairs to the lobby, and ask whomever was sitting at the front desk for whatever you needed, be it information or an extra pillow. My parents' room was so hideous, we wondered if "Candid Camera" was hiding nearby filming their reaction! (Our room seemed like the Queen of England's quarters in comparison!) The window in their room overlooked a sort of cement courtyard/alley. A "courtyard" may sound somewhat charming, but I assure you this one was not. There were no plants or greenery in this courtyard. Just a randomly tossed half-roll of toilet paper. And the only access to it seemed to be via climbing out the window itself! Given that their bathroom overlooked the same creepy "courtyard", I suppose if a guest ran out of toilet paper it would be quicker to simply crawl out the window to get that half roll of TP rather than having to tidy up, get dressed, and walk downstairs to the lobby to ask the sole deskman if he could bring you a fresh roll! The location is good, but I would pick a different hotel in the area (or happily go back to the Tryp Apolo) should I decide to visit Barcelona again.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain Hotel right next to the Ports and Metro”
Reviews.Author: Gez14
Reviews.Content: Great location, literally around the corner from Barceloneta Metro Station. If you're coming from the airport get a T10 card and it's just two short train journeys. Buffet breakfast of bread, meat, cheese, cereal etc basic but enough to fill you up before heading out into the city. Modern rooms, newly fitted bathrooms - only downside to our room was we were overlooking the main road and whilst the view was nice, it was quite loud all night long - this was made worse by ongoing building works down the street. For a quick city break this hotel was perfect for what we needed it for! Do be aware of pickpockets - we nearly had a backpack and suitcase stolen...it was only because we were on guard that we were aware we had been "marked" by the pickpockets!

Reviews.Title: “lovely staff amazing room !”
Reviews.Author: motorbikeminx
Reviews.Content: Well situated hotel with brilliant links to the underground. The staff were friendly and incredibly helpful. The room was modern, very clean and stylish with superb shower. It clearly looked like the room had been recently modernised. Breakfast could do with a little improvement, but was optional. We requested a quiet room and it was. All in all a very a pleasant stay and brilliant value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Walls are paper thin; no sleeping allowed”
Reviews.Author: skkc
Reviews.Content: I would advise against staying in this hotel unless you don't mind staying awake all night. I stayed there for one night in October, as I wanted to be close to the pier where my cruise ship was departing the next day. BIG MISTAKE. Stay somewhere else. I got little to no sleep. The walls were paper thin. I could hear the guy in the room next door peeing, coughing, talking, you name it, I heard it. I also heard a couple 2 doors down coming in from their evening out. They recanted the entire day's events, much to my chagrin. I would NOT stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “oasis”
Reviews.Author: AndyC94
Reviews.Content: clean hotel,close to metro and regional train station.plenty of cafes near the harbour.close to port olimpic and a short walk to ramblas

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: ozpix
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night in mid Novemeber 09. This hotel was better than expected as it seems to have recently been through a major renovation. Once you walk inside, everything seems very new, sleek & modern. Our room was not huge, but not small either, however it looked great, & more than met our needs. The Location was fantastic, being less than 5 min walk From Train station 'Estacio Franca" (regional trains including ones from france). About 10 min walk to 'La Rumbla', & had many other cool places nearby. The Receptionest reccommended a funky Tapas bar for Dinner ony a few mins walk away & it turned out to be great with us all enjoying a great night out. A great find in a great city!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Oasis”
Reviews.Author: PaulJ1
Reviews.Content: Very nice motel.....stayed in the recently renovated part....very nice!

Reviews.Title: “better than expected”
Reviews.Author: BTDTAtlanta_Georgia
Reviews.Content: very pleased with Hotel. The location was very good for sight seeing and close to many resturants and pubs. The front desk clerks were helpful and friendly. I made reservations via the internet and was able to get a very good price for a triple room including breakfast. The room was clean and roomy. The only downside for us was check-in time is 1pm and our flight from US arrived at 7:30 am. The Hotel has a bag lock up for guest, if you have the energy to dive right in to touring the city.

Reviews.Title: “A reasonably priced modern hotel with a great location.”
Reviews.Author: JanLouTallahassee_FL
Reviews.Content: The hotel Oasis in Barcelona is a clean modern hotel located just blocks from La Rambla, the waterfront, and Gothic Quarter. It was reasonably priced and close to the train station. You can travel from the airport to the Estacio de Franca train station just a couple blocks from the hotel. Warning - you will need to change trains to get to the hotel - the directions I received from one site (not the hotel's site) made it sound like it was a direct trip. There is also a metro station just a couple blocks from the hotel, but most of the sites are an easy walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great prices!”
Reviews.Author: Flying_Marc
Reviews.Content: Good budget hotel in Barcelona city centre. Nice clean rooms. Quiet and calm. The hotel is located close to port well marina and it is easy walking distance to beaches or shopping. The only problem I had during my stay is that the channels on the tv was porly adjusted. There are not very good facilities for business people. But for some vacation days in Barcelona this is highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a city break”
Reviews.Author: Lante
Reviews.Content: This good value hotel is ideally located just 100m from the Barceloneta Metro, which gives direct access to many of the 'must-see' sights of Barcelona. It's also only two stops from Quinacaona Metro which is a very short walk from Catalunys Square where the Airport bus terminates.. In around 5 minutes one can walk to the Marina,and to the area of Barceloneta, both offering numerous choices of eating and drinking. In the other direction the Picasso Museum, the Born district and the Ramblas are quickly accessed on foot. The hotel itself is well maintained, the rooms, whilst not large, are clean and comprtable with a fantastic shower. We had an internal 4th floor room with only a viewless window but that meant it was absolutely quiet at all times. The reception staff were very pleasant and helpful. Excellent value for money!.

Reviews.Title: “excellant value for money”
Reviews.Author: Julie W
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the standard of the hotel and our room which was modern and clean. Beds were comfortable. Breakfast was very good and plentiful. Staff were very friendly. Couldn't fault our stay and was the perfect position for walking to the marina, beach, shops, and sight-seeing around the city. Would definitely recomend.

Reviews.Title: “should be a 4 star but rooms are small”
Reviews.Author: Tommythumper
Reviews.Content: we were really really pleased with our stay in the oasis. The room was spotless and the location was just perfect. We were walking distance to the Picaso muesum and La Ramblas. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful and made sure we were happy while we stayed there. My one complaint is that at 11.30am on the morning of our leave, we had 2 maids come and bang on our door telling us go, I tried to explain to them that checkout was 12.00 but they didnt understand my English. They eventually left but they were not happy.The reception staff later confirmed that it was 12 0.clock check out. I guess they just wanted to get on with thier job and then go home! My husbands wallet was pickpocketed whilst there, it happened by the pier where all the clubs and restaurants are. It was in the evening and the two men that did it was asking my husband to come to their nightclub. (you have zillions of people asking you too come to thier club or dine in their restaurant) pls be alertl when you are approached.

Reviews.Title: “Much Better than my Expectations!!”
Reviews.Author: HolidayQueen00
Reviews.Content: After reading previous reviews I was expecting the accomodation to be very average and slightly scruffy/unkempt. What a delight when the taxi dropped us off at this clean and presentable hotel. The reception staff were pleasant and very competent and the rooms/corridors were decorated in a modern style (laminated floors/key card doors/illuminated room numbers/trendy bathroom etc). Rooms were cleaned every day and towels were changed daily. My only grumble would be road noise as we were in a room with double doors opening onto the road in front, but with the doors shut it didn't cause us any disturbance so at night it was fine, and I feel it should be expected when staying in the centre of a large city! This minor downside was far outweighed by the benefits of being in a nicely presentated and comfortable hotel which was well located and in walking distance of all the main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: omern
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a triple room with two friend at October. We arrive around midnight, and the check in was very quick. The room was reasonable size, good size shower, clean and tidy. The breakfasts were rich, with a variaty of food and drinks. The staff was cooperative, and pretty nice. Lot of the guests were in their 50's, but as young people that looked for prime location and reasonable price, it was the optimal choice. it is located 1 minute walk from a subway station (barceloneta), and five minutes walk from the train station taking you to and from the airport. It is also at the begining of the old quarter of barcelona, and 10 minutes walk from La Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “dont go there..”
Reviews.Author: ElRudolfo
Reviews.Content: Yes I must admit that it was cheap for a Barcelona but sleeping on a bench or tent is much cheaper and more comfortable indeed. The air condicioner wasn´t working and no one cared about the complaints. So it was about 35 c at night and was pretty hard to get some sleep and the smell from sewer was an attraction! The sink was out of order and the mosquitos were horrible. I dont like to whine but maybe we were given just the crappiest room in house so watch out you could be the next! We had several good nights in other hostels& apartments with even less money.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rueskov
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights at 60 Euros a night - no breakfast included but there are plenty of (quite expensive) places to have breakfast nearby. Small, clean room with a closet, table, two chairs and a table with a tv. Okay bathroom with shower in the tub, sink with mirror, bidet and wc. Soap and shampoo provided on a daily basis. Best asset is the location close to the city and the beach. Aircon not to efficient. Nice hotel lobby. Hotel looks a bit shabby from the outside. Liked everything except the sewer smell in the street next to the hotel and the many mosquitos at night - and I think you can't blame the management for that.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: Nyw0man
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for 6 nights while visiting Barcelon. The location was excellent, as many have already mentioned. The breakfast that was included in the room rate was definitively adequate, but no more. Our room was very small, it was an interior room, so we had now windows to look out, only a small one facing an airwell. It was very quiet, the bathroom was nicely done, with a good shower. The front desk, when staffed by the younger members were terrific, but one day there was an older gentleman who didn't know anything and directed us completely wrong. Wi-Fi is 3 Euros per 24 hours. Housekeeping could be better. All in all it is a very good value in an expensive city. The best part was the location.

Reviews.Title: “it is what it is, comfy & clean budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: davinaBelfast
Reviews.Content: Had a week in this hotel, the room wasa very small, but the bathroom was great with a great power shower. The breakfast's are a little disappointing, buffet but none of the fresh fruit which is so abundent in the local markets. Great location, in the middle of everything and just opposite the Barceloneta stop on the subway which was great for travelling throughout the city. Overall a nice simple place to stay and in an expensive city not a bad price for what it is. D Belfast

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but thin walls”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_Couple_UK
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend in early March. This is a budget hotel (2 stars) and it shows the hallmarks of a budget hotel - thin walls, temperamental heating and hot water and in need a of renovation (some paint peeling on the ceiling and walls). The room we stayed in was of a good size and clean. The bathroom was also a good size and clean enough. But as I mentioned earlier - the hotel is in need of a refurbishment. When staying in a budget hotel you can't expect everything to be perfect. In our case it was the peeling paint on the ceiling and walls. This was only in a few places and I'm sure most people can live with this. The heater in the room was warm enough, but the controls seemed to be not working to well. While there was hot water, it took so some to kick in. Once it started there was no problems with the hot water. The hotel was experiencing problems with the hot water on Level 2, so this may have contributed to the slowness of the hot water (we stayed on Level 1). Depending on where in the hotel your room is located, the thin walls may be an issue on 2 fronts: (1) noise from the street and (2) noise from the hallway. The hotel is off a main road. Lots of cars come off the main road to use the street that the hotel is on. Combine this with the thin walls and you have a noisy room. In addition to the traffic, there is construction work next door to the hotel. The construction workers start early. The hallway (as are the rooms) are tiled so noise from people talking and rolling their bags tends to echo in the hallway and into the room. The staff at the hotel were very helpful and very pleasant to talk to. They all speak very good English and were able to give us good tips with our sightseeing questions. The best aspect of this hotel is its location. Just outside Barri Gotic, it is a pleasant walk to Barri Gotic (less than 5 mins) and Las Ramblas (10 mins) via the old laneways of the old city. The tapas bars, restaurants, museums, sights and shops of Barri Gotic are one of the highlights of of Barcelona. The hotel is also close to the waterside area of Barceloneta, where you will find door to door seafood restaurants (great in the warmer months where you can eat outside). The area around the hotel is safe. Even late at night, we did not feel unsafe walking back to the hotel as the road is full of traffic and people walking to the metro station. In terms of transportation, the hotel has great public transport links. It is 2 mins around the corner from Barceloneta Metro station and about 5 mins walk from Estació de França train station (also known as Barcelona Franca / Barcelona Estació de França). You can get a train from Barcelona Airport to Estació de França. You may need to transfer at Barcelona's main train station (Estació de Sants / Barcelona Sants) for services to Estació de França. If you are planning to take a few public transport trips during your stay in Barcelona, at the Airport train station make sure you buy a T-10 ticket for EUR 7.70. It allows travel all over Barcelona on the Metro, trains, buses, trams. It is great value for money if you are travelling to the sights around Barcelona - which are all accessible by a great Metro system. I would recommend this hotel if you are looking for a basic hotel with a good location and helpful staff, but you should ask for a quieter room (maybe close to the back of the hotel?)

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location to train station, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: swintontraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night after a cruise, arrived at the hotel at 10am and knew we wouldn't be able to check in 'til later but it wasn't a problem as there was a secure room to store your luggage,just remember to take your valuables. The hotel is in a great location for the beach, Gothic area , Parc Cuitadella. For the short time we had in Barcelona we crammed a lot in. N.B. Museums and galleries tend to be closed on Mondays, we were there on a Monday. We had room 317, one of the older rooms but it was perfectly adequate for one night. It was on an internal corridor so no views, advantage of this was no noise from the road. The room was quite large , plenty of space. We did walk past 315 when the door was open and it was TINY, no room hardly to walk around the double bed !! Even though our room was not one of the newly renovated ones it still felt modern, key card entry system, nice tiles in the bathroom, hairdryer supplied. we paid 40Euros for the room. I wonder how much the prices will go up once the renovations are finished ! We took the train to the airport from the Franca station around the corner. We were in Barcelona in Jan and checked out doing this then. You no longer can get a train direct to the airport from Franca station, you have to change at Estacion de Sants or Gracia. If you do this I recommend you change at Gracia as there are only 2 platforms and you literally get off one train, stay on the platform and wait for the airport train. It wasn't difficult and we had one large suitcase each with hand luggage . There is a small supermarket across the road from the Franca train station main entrance if you need any provisions, water etc. I could find no faults with this hotel. If we had been staying longer than one night I may have requested a move for a room with a view but we had a peaceful night's sleep which was the main thing for us when we had to get up early for the flight home.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel at affordable price”
Reviews.Author: Steven_De_Clercq
Reviews.Content: we (me and a girlfriend) stayed at the hotel for 2 nights ( 27/02/09 - 01/03/09 ). We had chamber number 402 (think I). Lain on 4e floor beside the elevator. Positively: Beautiful chamber. Positive first impression at to come in. Beautiful, neat, contemporary bathroom! Parquet floor in sleep chamber, flags in bathroom. Neat chamber. Nothing heard of crash of the lift (our chamber was lain next to the elevator). Breakfast had been well extended and rather. sleep chamber, bathroom, entrance hall (counter) and breakfast space were all complete net! Disadvantage: Small bed and thin windows. Differently no negative points. The thin windows were most terrible. Windows with glass were only. For the low price this a real windfall and must were. staff was very friendly en was verry politely! Verry good location. verry near the subway (subway barcelonetto around the corner) and the station. Ramblas within walking distance. near parc de la ciutadella. near the museum Picasso. Verry near to BORN (= old town) with verry good restaurants, great atmosphere, pubs,.... would

Reviews.Title: “Good location but very small shabby rooms”
Reviews.Author: viva12
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location close the marina. On first impressions the hotel looks very stylish, this is due to a recent refit. The whole of the hotel is going through a well deserved upgrade and the newly decorated rooms do look good especially the bathrooms but the existing rooms are in a poor state of repair and are extremely small. The rooms however are clean but do feel very cramped if more than one person is trying to get dressed. This is also a very rowdy hotel in the early hours of the morning. I was woken up at 5am with slamming doors and shouting this continued for several hours, not enjoyable! The staff however are very helpful. If I had to recommend a hotel it would not be this one, my preference would be the Petite Palace hotel chain.

Reviews.Title: “Definately reccomend for price, location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: NoSeMeLLamo
Reviews.Content: This is a basic hotel with no frills but is clean, has helpful staff and the location is perfect for exploring the city. Would definately return here again. The reviews were mixed but it depends on what you expect, for the money you pay it is def worth it. The breakfast was enough to get you started for the day and the staff were helpful and friendly, the rooms were basic but clean and there was constant hot water. If your looking for luxury then it's not ideal, but for some where to stay for cheap it's one of the best I've ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly great little hotel for a bargain price!”
Reviews.Author: lambs2
Reviews.Content: Mu husband booked this hotel for our one pre-cruise night in Barcelona because of the great price and close proximity to the cruise port. I was not sure what to expect after reading some of the reviews. We boarded the Renfre train from the airport early in the morning. Because of the good directions I found here on Tripadvisor it was rather easy to find the hotel, although we were pulling our considerable amount of luggage (for a 21 day cruise plus several days after) along with us. Here are the direction which I have expanded a bit from the ones I had. Get from Estacio de Franca to the hotel as follows: Turn left after exiting the station. Follow the sidewalk for less than 5 minutes, then turn left on Pla De Palau. The Oasis Hotel is at 17. We were told by the nice person at the front desk that check-in would not be until after 1 pm, but they had a luggage room we could use, so we left our bags there and set off to explore the Gotic area of Barcelona, just a few blocks away, for a few hours. When we returned our room was ready. So grabbed our bags and headed up on the elevator to our 4th floor room. Although quite small, our room had a very comforable queen-sized bed, large with lots of storage room, and a lovely glass door bath with granite counter top and raised bowl sink. Very up-to-date and obviously newly redocorated. Because we had virtually no sleep for almost 24 hours, we took short, less than two hour nap. then proceeded to head to the Picasso Museum just a coupler blocks from the Oasis and then a delightful early dinner/ late lunch at Teller Tapas restaurant. After that we took a nice stroll to the Park de la Ciutadella and enjoyed seeing Barcelona's own Arc de Triomf which was created for the 1888 Great Exhibition of Barcelona. After a very good night's sleep we thoroughly enjoyed the included breakfast buffet at the Oasis before leaving for a couple hours walk along the waterfront and then up Las Ramblas to Placa Catalunya and back. It was then time for us to get our luggage and check out of this wonderful, conveniently located hotel and head to our cruiseship. We will certainly plan to stay again at the conveniently located Oasis Hotel should our travel adventures bring us back to the delightful city of Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and great value”
Reviews.Author: millygilly
Reviews.Content: This was a perfect hotel for our stay and great value! All we were looking for was somewhere to base ourselves for our long weekend in Barcelona. We were up early in the mornings and back late at night so spent very little time in our room. The room was quite small and very basic. It was very clean and suited us fine, we werent looking for anything fancy! room cost us 70 euro per night. Breakfast is served (optional extra) for 8euro per person, it's a buffet so you can fill up before your day of sight seeing, I would recommend it! Location wise, it is on a quite enough street, we didnt hear any noise during the night. It is bout 10min walk to Las Ramblas and 10mins the other direction to the beaches. It is 5min walk to the Port. We loved the location. There is a tourist bus stop across the road from the hotel, I would definitely recommend buying a 2 day ticket for the tourist bus, one day is not enough to see all the fabulous sights of Barcelona! If you're looking for a cheap and clean hotel with no fancy frills then i would absolutley recommend this hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever - handbag stolen at the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: viking891
Reviews.Content: At the first day at the hotel, my handbag was stolen while I was in the hotel bar. This was early in the evening with almost no people in the bar. The most distrustful part is that when we said that we where guests at the hotel, my bag was returned outside the hotel lobby after 25 min, with everything there except my camera, cell phone and money. The staff at the hotel laughed at us when we told them about the theft and what happened, said it must have been an invisible man, and did not care or help us. When we said that we found this experience stressful, they became rude and started arguing with us instead of taking this seriously. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Panda2me
Reviews.Content: A great little hotel in a good location. Rooms a little small as is the breakfast room. We had one of the new refurbished rooms which was modern and clean. For this price it was excellent value. Staff were friendly and helpful. For a short stay hotel so you can see the sights it is spot on!

Reviews.Title: “great city”
Reviews.Author: nicky_s22
Reviews.Content: we spent 2 night here while on our honeymoon. great location of the hotel. the staff is not very friendly or helpful. breakfast is good. the elevator broke dowm after 2 day so we has to walk until 3 rd floor. also there was some work being done on our floor so on the afternoon there was some noise. rooms are small with a small window overviewing an interior court. no air, a lot of heat.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: carrickbeg
Reviews.Content: A nice enough hotel in a great location, within walking distance of Las Ramblas and the Port. The rooms were on the small side, but we were out all the time so it didn’t matter. The breakfast/bar area downstairs is quite small too, and not someplace you’d want to hang out in, but why would you, when there’s so many bars to choose from within walking distance. Breakfast was basic but fine, the rooms were clean, as were all the public areas, and the staff were friendly enough. All in all, a good choice if you’re looking for somewhere not too expensive but close to Las Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good price but dingy rooms - ok for short stay only”
Reviews.Author: Jetsettingjoyce
Reviews.Content: The positives: 5 minutes from Estacio de Franca (direct train to airport in 30 minutes for 1.70 euros), 5 minutes from Barceloneta metro station and 5 minutes to the heart of Born and Barri Gotic (shopping and eating!). Also, friendly staff and very cheap (50 euros for a single room, including breakfast). The negatives: the rooms are dingy, the bathroom's ancient, it's pretty noisy and the breakfasts are nothing special. It worked for me, but it's not somewhere I would actively recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I've ever stayed in...”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_Lewis
Reviews.Content: I booked a lastminute cheap trip to Barcelona last week and I accept that 'you get what you pay for' but this hotel was truly awful. Here goes... It's right to next to a big building site, which was right outside my window. There was even a construction rubbish shute running down outside my window. But as well as contending with the building noise there was noise literally all night long from other guests and from the street (rubbish collection etc). I don't expect dead silence when I'm sharing a hotel with other people and in a city but this was unbelievable - banging doors, shouting, swearing etc. The walls are paper thin so when I'd wake up at 3am it was as if my room had just been invaded! The room was very outdated in style with a pathetic excuse for a shower that flooded the whole room. The 2nd floor I was on looked like something out of a ropey 1970s hall of residence in the UK, or a prison. I guess I could have moved but I'd paid in full up front and didn't want to lose the money. I could have complained but the service on the front desk was so listless that I doubted it would make any difference at all - and perhaps my fault for not speaking good enough spanish. Bascially this hotel was so bad it was funny. The ONLY good thing was the location as it was a few minutes to the beach and right round the corner from the station where you can get a direct train from the airport so for me travelling on my own, very easy to get around. An experience, but not one I would recommend! Luckily I had such a great time in Barcelona it didn't spoil it, I'm just glad I hadn't taken my husband there with me...

Reviews.Title: “"Great value for money hotel"”
Reviews.Author: GeebyStHelens
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weekend stay at the 'Oasis' Hotel in Barcelona and thoroughly enjoyed it. The location and staff where excellent helping us on many occasions. The room was small but ample. The breakfast was fine and my wife liked the scrambled eggs and bacon! It was handy for all site seeing trips including close proximity to beach, Port Olympica, Ramblas, cathedral etc... The main station -Estacio de Franca was round the corner from the hotel. When we got off the plane, we purchased a T10 train ticket at the Renfe station which is linked to the airport by a bridge. It cost 7.2 Euros and could be used on all Barcelona public transport ten times which we found to be great value for money. We used the T10 mostly on underground trains as the Barceloneta station was right near our hotel. One word of caution, when visiting Gaudis 'La Pedrera' house do not eat at the 'Baguetina Catalana' on the Paseg De Gracia as it costs 30 Euros for two rolls, two drinks and one cake!

Reviews.Title: “its ok”
Reviews.Author: jemmimma
Reviews.Content: i stayed at this hotel a year ago, it was having work done at that time, but it was no problem. i was a bit scared about it after reading some reviews. for the star rating that it has, its really in good conditions, the rooms were very small but clean. the staff was helpfull. the breakfast was not bad and included in price. it has a central location that allows you to walk anywere, but also has the metro very close. i recomend this hotel if your on a budget, and looking for something basic but clean.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: stegbhoy
Reviews.Content: booked this hotel for the football in march,checked in quite late on the sunday night and was very suprised by the hotel ,excellent rooms ,cheap price was on the 5th floor but lift was working all the time,view was not up to much but overall was very pleased with this hotel.would recommened it to anyone who is looking for a nice hotel on the cheap.there were 3 of us staying in one room all single beds maid service everyday rooms were spotless.

Reviews.Title: “Go to Another Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MountainLionsagogo
Reviews.Content: Prior to our trip to Spain, we did our due diligence and checked out tripadvisor regarding the Hotel Oasis in Barcelona. The comments seemed to run in two extremes- glowing and bad. People liked it a lot, and had nothing but great things to report, or they did not have a good experience, which was also reported. Unfortunately, our experience fell in line with many of the experiences listed by the latter. Our Room For us a hotel is strictly utilitarian. Its a place to hang our hats at night. We do not book high end accommodations and we have little expectation of grand amenities. We stayed at the Oasis mid February 2008, and the room was stuffy-no just plain hot! The air conditioning did not work and a fan was already in the room. It did nothing but push the warm stale air. The room did have a window, but it opened to an air well that was capped on the roof. In order to sleep we rigged the door, so we were safe while it was ajar. This allowed for heavenly fresh air circulation. We wondered what this room would be like in the summer, uggg. Being energy conscious, the hotel had a motion sensor for the light in the hallway of the location of our room. The lights went on and off all night long. This was odd because our room was on a wing with only one other room, and it was vacant. Yep, you guessed it-a Rat!!!! Breakfast We booked through Hotels.com, and a major selling point for the Oasis was that our booking included breakfast. If it did not, we would have gone elsewhere. We were only in Spain for two weeks and wanted to get out and see the country not hunt down restaurants for morning coffee and toast. We got our meal tickets for days one and two-no problem. We simply went to the desk and the Manager handed them to us. No talk of room number or money. The third day we went to the desk and a different clerk asked us for 8.90€ a piece ($24.48). All we said that breakfast was included in our package. To which he shot out of his chair and said “I only work here, you must talk to the manager.” We later had a giggle about this guy’s dramatic performance. We spoke to the manager the next morning; he crossed his arms and shook his head and said “no” then turned his back on us to do something else. We let it go, until we could take the issue up with Hotels.com, the company who took our money. Upon check out the manager tried to charge us for the first two days worth of breakfast. We told him it was included and had him look it up on Hotels himself. He let the issue go, by again folding his arms, shaking his head no, and walking away. Scary. We went on to Madrid for our second week in Spain. Our Opinion The amount we paid for our room at the Hotel Oasis, was well in line with all of the surrounding hotels. We are not spoiled American tourists with expectations of grandeur when it comes to a room. We stay in hotels so we can see the World not a hotel, but we also do not expect to get a room too hot to sleep, see rats and experience the old bait and switch! This hotel has a great location and the property itself has potential to be really nice, with better management it could probably be a place to write home about, not a dissenting opinion on Tripadvisor.com.

Reviews.Title: “A 'curate's egg' hotel.”
Reviews.Author: LesD
Reviews.Content: First the good points. Great location with easy access from outside Barcelona - especially by car - although the urban motorways get jammed in the rush hours. Also easy to get to most of the tourist places downtown. Good public transport - buses and Metro stop nearby. Free off-road overnight parking across the road. Meters go off at 20:00 and come on at 09:00. Great breakfast buffet spread - including delicious hot scrambled eggs! Friendly bar attached - open late. Useful vending machines with (cold) snacks and drinks. Very friendly staff - many English speakers. Now the negatives. VERY thin walls to bedrooms - not much better than cardboard. Room decoration VERY tired and in need of updating. The bathtub (in the room I had!) was really only a 'deep' shower tray. OK for me, but no use for anyone wanting to lounge in the water for an hour or so! Because of the location, it seems to be on the main route for the emergency services! They do seem to quieten them somewhat at night, but they are still audible. So, in summary, I'd say above average for services, but definitely below average for room quality.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is in a great location. It was clean and the staff were very friendly.”
Reviews.Author: Perk1e
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel very late into the evening/early morning. flight was with Ryanair and landed an hour outside of the city but the staff were really helpful and spoke very good english. The hotel is almost next to the Barceloneta metro stop. You come out of the tube station and turn right. The hotel was clean and quiet. It was almost opposite the harbour. The breakfast selection was very good. Cereals, breads and meats and cakes. They catered for all nationalities. Some Germans in the hotel but not many. The tourist bus is just across the road, to the right of the hotel. this is the one from last stop on the southern route. The zoo is almost next to us but you couldnt hear anything. There is a lovely park right near the hotel which is perfect for a morning stroll. The Ramblas is about at 30 min stroll from the hotel - you just walk along the seafront and turn right. I would definately stay there again. The price is perfect and the service is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad but not great!”
Reviews.Author: oakergill
Reviews.Content: My friend and i stayed here for 2 nights from 11 to 13 Feb. We book a superior twin room and got a tiny room with 3 sindle beds in it. It was clean and functional but that was it. The location was good. The downside was you could hear the people in the next room in the bathroom, you could hear EVERYTHING. If you get the chance try to get a meal at Sinatras, just off the Rambla the food was FANTASTIC! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: tibsCo_Meath
