Reviews.Content: i was really worried about our stay in the oasis after reading some of these reviews .. but was pleasantly surprised it was lovely the room was small but we didnt mind that ... it was spotless staff were very friendly and helpfull ... i loved it and would defenitely go back...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Locarion”
Reviews.Author: ArmaghWanderers
Reviews.Content: Travelled to this hotel in January 2008. Following a short 2hr flight we boarded the train at Barcelona Airport. 25mins later we were at Estacio del Franca train station. This should cost 3.70euro but we were given free tickets in each direction. Turned left from station and walked for less than 5 mins and arrived at hotel. Greeted by really friendly staff in a bright reception area. Took lift to our small but very clean room. A small bright bathroom in the room was also immaculately presented. Las Ramblas was with 15mins walk from the hotel and the lively area of Barceloneta was 5 min the other direction. Two nights B&B in this excellent budget hotel was less that £70 for a double room. A real bargain. To sum up, this is a great hotel for the cost conscious traveller in an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great sangria !”
Reviews.Author: JLH_Bristol
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a three day trip to Barcelona, staying two nights at this hotel, and would definitely recommend it. I would like to return to Barcelona in the future and when I do so will certainly be planning to stay in this hotel again. The location is perfect - less than a minute stroll to both the metro station and tourist bus, two minutes to a whole row of bars / cafes / restaurants and 5 minutes walk to the port. We were nervous about what our room would be like after reading some reviews on this website but we were certainly relieved when we checked into our room and it was great, no complaints at all. The reception staff were very nice and extremely helpful and there was no problem with arriving at the hotel early in the morning and leaving our suitcases in a locked store room in order that we could go out for the day and return to check in later. This was the same on check out day. There is a good bar in the hotel, also open to and used by the public. Try the jugs of sangria - lovely !!

Reviews.Title: “Wish I liked it better, but alas, it was just adequate....”
Reviews.Author: Overtheline
Reviews.Content: The price was dirt cheap (about $60 per night including breakfast for two) per night for our 5 night stay. Don't expect much and you won't be disappointed. While our room was badly needing a re-do, it was clean. The location is it's best selling point. You really can walk to most everything of interest. Metro stop is next door, Estacio de Franca is around the corner and the Marinas are just up the street (but not the cruise port - it's a short cab ride away). A few of the staff are down right surly, but the few that shine make it tolerable. It is a very noisy place. Don't expect english on the TV - just CNN and maybe a sports channel. Bottom line - it's fine for one or two nights, but if you're staying longer, find something a little nicer that you can look forward to returning to at the end of a long day of touring the city. The following has nothing to do with the hotel: A final warning about Barcelona - BEWARE OF PICKPOCKETS! One night while on la Rambla a group of young asian girls approached and surrounded us offering us sex, all the while passing their hands over you looking for your wallet. Managed to escape that attempt only to get stung the next day. While in a small square where cafe tables were set up for a couple of restaurants, a guy approached and said something was all over the back of my jacket and pants. From what I could see it looked like vomit (or worse) and when he offered to wash it off (in the restroom of the restaurant) I let him lead me there. While brushing whaterver it was, he was expertly checking all the usual spots where tourists think they can cleverly hide their wallets from crooks. My wallet was in a zipped pockets in the lining of my jacket. Within 2 minutes of his departure I realized my wallet was lone gone and so was the crook. It took me about 15 minutes to walk to the police station and the very first thing they had me do was to call the credit card companies. In just that short period of time, the crook had managed to charge over $1,000 to one of my cards!!! A little advice..... Keep a record of your credit card numbers in a seperate place. DON'T carry your social security card! - EVER! Keep a photo copy of all your documents in a seperate bag on let your travel partner carry them.

Reviews.Title: “Holes Everywhere”
Reviews.Author: SDWanderlust
Reviews.Content: Location: Not located in the old city. About 10 min walk to the Las Rambla, the launching pad for most travelers. Metro station is about 3 minute walk from hotel. Also, there are a bit of things to see and do around the hotel-the Barceloneta and the Port areas. Overall, the location is great. The room: It was a mixed bag. I got an old room. It was really bad. There were holes everywhere; on the wall, the floor, the ceiling. Since I had a single room, it was understandably smaller than usual double. Because of the poor lay out of the room, it was really dark. Say, during the daytime, if you were to read something, you would have to have the light turned on. The walls were very dirty looking. The bathroom was very small. There was mildew everywhere on the shower stall. The door was also very thin therefore I heard everything when someone talking in the hallway. Unfortunately, there other young travelers, it got very loud. The room was very appalling. Granted that it was a two star establishment, it really was beyond my belief when I first saw it. However, the common areas, such as the breakfast room and the reception area, were very nice. Those were recently renovated. I suspect that renovated rooms would be in much better shape. Service: The folks at front desk were always nice and friendly for the most part. The same can be said about folks at the breakfast buffet. Regarding the breakfast buffet, choices were very limited. I had toast and jam everyday. There were hard-boiled eggs. There was also salad, something I thought was rather odd. Salad for breakfast? There were cold cuts. However, there was no fruit of any kind. The OJ was very diluted. I think it was just water and some yellow color they put in. Recommendation: I would not recommend this place unless you know for sure that you will get recently renovated room. I paid about 55 euros per night for a single, which I think was neither excessive nor cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed with the management”
Reviews.Author: Sam75
Reviews.Content: My friend and I have just got back from staying at the Oasis. I'll start with the plus points: Great location, local to many amenities, only 10 minutes walk from Las Ramblas and about 2 minutes from the start of the harbour. Price includes a cold buffet, which although basic was an advantage. Minus points: I paid for a 'superior' room and got what I woul describe as a basic room, although it was clean. Horrendously noisy Italians staying on the same floor who had absolutely no consideration for other guests and who decided to start arguments with each other , play fight in the corridors and come in from their night out at all times, whilst screaming at each other down the corridor. We requested the management to speak to the Italians concerned, but they just called the room to tell them to be quiet which worked for all of a nanosecond. Also when we asked to be moved the following day, we were told there were no rooms available , although we had been told the night before that there would be, as there were guests checking out. My friend is pregnant and so needs her sleep, but nothing seemed to change the mind of the management to allow us to move. Their attitude was that they had our money and hard luck! They said they would speak to those concerned, but it made not one blind bit of difference as they were just as bad if not worse on the second night, despite being asked to be quiet, which completly spoilt our stay. My friend was very ill on our final day due to lack of sleep and stress. I would not stay at this hotel again, due to the attitude of the management - shameful that they showed such little respect for their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: JNNN
Reviews.Content: This hotel is such good value for money. I went with my girlfriend in Nov 2007. The hotel is in a brilliant location, there was no need to use the metro even though the station is 2mins walk down the road! The Bus touristic stop is located on the square where the hotel is - I definately advise anyone to take the tour! Port Vell is very close and has superb restaurants by the harbour. Even in November the city was bustling with locals and tourists. The receptionists were all very willing to help and booked us restaurant reservations on two occations and a taxi to the airport. The breakfast buffet is pleasant and will suit anyones tastes! Finally I strongly recommend a guide book just to give you a background knowledge of the nice restaurants in the area or you could ask the receptionists where they recommend! I used the AA barcelona city pack which was great! Hope this helps, Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “renovated or not.....”
Reviews.Author: travellaklb
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a trip to barcelona which included flight and accomodation. Originally we were going to just book our flight and wing the accomodation. Its a good thing we did not because Aug is prime season and there are no vacancies anywhere in Barcelona (if you dont like millions of tourists then avoid Barcelona in Aug). When trying to decide on where to stay we looked at reviews on tripadvisor. Hotel Oasis got mixed reviews and we decided to take a chance. When we arrived we realised why there were mixed reviews, half the hotel is renovated and the other half is a glorified hostel. The hotel fails to mentiont that in their website and when booking. Unfortunately we got the glorified hostel which was clean, specially the bathroom but overall the room was very rundown. Our bed we beyond uncomfortable and we complained to the hotel. The hotel was fully booked and there was no way to move rooms. After 3 days we moved to the renovated area at no extra cost. The front desk was very understanding and helpful. The breakfast was very basic but had variety (breads, cheeses, hardboiled eggs, cereals,fruit etc) and kept us full. The location was really awesome, 10min walk to La Rambla and the beach. Barcelona is a very big city and we highly recommend renting bikes and doing a bike tour. The Spanish cuisine is nothing to brag about but if you stay off main streets (specially La Rambla), you can find a decent meal. We also recommend going to cities outside Barcelona like Girona and Figueres.

Reviews.Title: “Old versus refurbished”
Reviews.Author: shopdummy
Reviews.Content: I'm surprised by some of the recent reviews here but I guess it depends on which part of the hotel you're in. My friend & I stayed here recently and booked via different websites; I was on a refurbished floor but she wasn't. My room was a twin whilst hers was a small single even though we both paid similar amounts (although breakfast wasn't included in mine). So I suppose it's best to check what you're getting when you book because they were quite different. My room seemed clean and well presented, especially for a two star hotel. The shower and TV both worked well (always a good sign!). Other facilities were okay: there was aircon & a hairdryer but no mini-bar/fridge to store cold drinks in, no kettle, no room safe, no room service. The receptionist we dealt with was very helpful. And the staff at breakfast seemed very on top of things - the buffet (8 EUR) was well supplied with cereals, coffee, tea, hot chocolate, pastries, rolls, etc. A good start to the day! The hotel location was excellent, just 5-10 mins walk from the train station, near La Ramblas and also near the beach & marina.

Reviews.Title: “Scabbies”
Reviews.Author: Volunteer13
Reviews.Content: As we arrived at the Oasis the staff was pleasent and helpful. Our room was small but seemed clean. There was paint missing and black marks on all the walls. When we returned from sight seeing our air conmditioner wasn't working. We told the front desk about it and they said they would send someone up to fix it because they didn't have any other rooms available for us to switch to. They never came to check on our unit. It began working again on its own later in the night. We stayed at the Oasis for 2 nights. When we awoke the second morning we noticed small red marks on our arms that itched. A week later when we finished our trip the spots had developed into large bumps over our entire bodies. When we returned home and saw our doctor he told us we had gotten scabbies from the bed. I am pregnant and cannot use to insecticide cream to remedy the bugs living under my skin. I will have to live with this condition for the next 8 months. My husband will also, because even if he uses the cream, I will continue to reinfect him. Obviously, we will never recommend this hotel to anyone or stay there again ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly and humid.”
Reviews.Author: ixtoc
Reviews.Content: Booked at hotelclub.com without problems. But the room I got was smelly and very very humid. It only had one tiny window to the inside of the building (very narrow) which means not very airy. There was an air conditioner but it smelled even worse than the room itself. I even saw a bug in the room (I didn't care much... i tried not to think what was in the bed because of all that humidity). The bathrooom seemed clean (at least better than the room). The water pressure was a bit low but anyway... I had an inconvenience with a staff member (the african-spanish one) who was very rude towards me. When I returned to the hotel and I wished to lift the key he yelled very impolitely at me saying: "What do you want?!". After I told him I wished a key he became a bit more friendly. It might be because I was a bit sweating since I had been hurrying back to the hotel (and it was hot outside)... The other two receptionists were very nice and polite. A breakfast was ok to me. Cold food though (ham, hard-boiled eggs, cheese, croissants and stuff like that), self service. The location is quite good. Somewhere between the Ramblas and the beach. It must be about 10-15 minutes walk from the Ramblas. And also about 15 minutes to the beach. The neighborhood seemed safe. So to conclude, I only spent like 4 hours in the room (including sleeping) so all those things didn't bother me much. But still, it was not a very nice experience and a hostal I stayed in some days before (near the Saints station, for half the price of Oasis) was much cleaner and nicer. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone and I certainly will not go there again although it is quite cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: sdh1412
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been recently refurbished. It is in a great location, just round the corner from the last stop of the Airport train line. 10 minutes walk to Las Ramblas and 10 minutes to the beach. The Marina is just across the road. I was travelling alone and tend to look towards the cheaper hotels. I was very impressed with this hotel and would not hesitate to return with my family (the ZOO is 5 minutes walk away). The room I stayed in was clean and tidy, a typical functional hotel room TV, bathroom etc. Breakfast was included and a good choice of food was provided. Altogether a bargain at about £32 per night. Would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: Tessita
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night at the hotel. I was pleasantly surprised that this was indeed a two star hotel (maybe even better). Most of the time, I feel I want to take a star away from hotels, but this one is a good two star. Location is great, minutes from the Gothic Quarter or 10-15 min. walk from the beaches. Staff was helpful and friendly. Rooms clean and basic. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant”
Reviews.Author: lizzieloo1
Reviews.Content: we stopped at the oasis for our honeymoon with some friends on their birthdays and we were very impressed for a 2 star the staff were friendly the breakfast bar good the food was being topped up all the time. it was been renivated on the side but made no difference to us it was clean and quite impressive on the inside. excellent location near les ramblers and the beach we were impressed and would return thanks oasis it was great

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ballymaguigan
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in the Oasis Hotel for 2 nigths in April 2007. We were worried about the hotel because of the low star rating but need not have worried. We arrived from the train station and the hotel was very easy to find within a few minutes walk. The room was not ready and we were told to come back at 1.00pm but they kept our bags for us in a safe place. The room was very large with 4 beds in it for 2 of us. There was a small balcony with a nice view of the square at the front of the hotel. The hotel was small but very clean. The location of the hotel was very good. We were able to walk everywhere. It is a short walk from the beach and the harbour. It is also a short walk to the end of the Las Ramblas. There is a tourist bus stop just beside the hotel. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel as it is very reasonably priced for Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Tati”
Reviews.Author: Tati_spb
Reviews.Content: Hello everybody! I want to write this rewiew for all travellers looking for where to stay in Barcelona and for who reserved it already. If honestly, choosing this hotel, i came from the price and from the location (just took a Barcelona map, marked where airport bus arrives at the city and where the main sights in the city) - Oasis was the best from every point of view. We paid only 39 euro per night for whole double, yes yes, for 2 persons (probably it was not a season and we didnt take a breakfast, i love to sleep as more as possible after night adventures :-))) For these money i waited for to see the awful hotel, how could i imagined, but ... Everything was not so bad! Take a look on my photos and you will understand yourself, i made everything i could (all photos will be in 2 reviews, coz i want to show everything). During we stayed at the hotel, reception place wasnt finished, so i can only suggest how it can be now. All receptionist were men (different ages!!! what is really strange for me, i used to young smiley girls :-))) Apropos, it was first hotel, which i reserved online, so i wanted to have not only site confirmation, but also hotel confirmation, so i wrote there a letter, but i didnt get an answer, and i tried to call to hotel, they said they havent any information about my reservation, i was a little bit in shock. But when we arrived, showed printed confirmation of reservation, everything was ok, receptionist just asked one passport and gave a card. I want to notice, rooms at the last floor have card keys, and at the lower floor usual keys with this awful thing which make you to stay it at the reception when u leave hotel. So i advice you to ask highest rooms if it will be possible. When we opened door, we saw a picture absolutely like on site photo, no surprises. Yes, it`s enough little, but for these money .... Everything looked clean, just i felt a smoke smell, i`ve called to the reception, asking could i have non-smoker room. they apologized saying that they dont have a room division for smoker and non-smoker. So it`s one of minuses. Bed linen is absolutely fresh and clean. Servise is daily, not importunate, i didnt notice them. If you put towels at the floor, they change it, if not, only clean. Also you have shower-gel every day (not luxurious sure, but dont forget hotel is pozitioned like 2 stars). There was some bruises at the walls of bathroom from hot water, but not criminal. And also one broken little part at the edge of the bath, but it was tidy painted over with white colouring (photos of this you can see in my second reveiw). About food i can not say anything, we didnt take it, just can say you can take good swedish table with normal choise and even glass of wine for 8 euro till the lunch time, and for 10 euro after, almost everywhere in the city. So you choose there! And now about the main preference of this hotel after its` price - it`s location of course. It`s on 5+++. Entrance to the metro - 50m. Bus stop - right near doors of hotel, and some else around, depends of direction. Stop of Barcelona bus (bus for traveller, which has stops near every sight in the city) - in 50 m from hotel. La Rambla is in 2 street`s crosses. Port (where is concentrated all night life) and beaches - probably this hotel is on the best location for them. So in summary: if you dont want to spend money for staying, if you are not going to spend 90% ur time in hotel, if you want to be in the center of all events - choose this hotel. If i will travel next time with the same amount of finances i will choose the same hotel without any doubt. Wish you nice holidays in Barcelona. It`s great city.

Reviews.Title: “Give it a miss”
Reviews.Author: kingmack91
Reviews.Content: Room was very small and reeked of smoke. Cheese at breakfast was moldy (not in the good way) and not really near anything. No where nearby to eat. The beds were also really small.

Reviews.Title: “central hotel”
Reviews.Author: avid
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights at this hotel. The reception area is now finished and is an attractive area. The hotel is very well situated for all the sights and attractions that Barcelona has to offer. The breakfast had plenty of choice the only thing lacking was no fruit option. The room we stayed in was basic but for the cost it is what we expected,the downside would be the noise through the walls as you can hear everything in the adjoining rooms. Overall you get a basic central hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Way too noisy”
Reviews.Author: TAmemberEngland
Reviews.Content: We booked the cheaper rooms for this hotel, so did not expect too much, however the room was very small with a tiny window, but the worst was the noise. You could hear everything that went on around you in neighbouring rooms, the TV, the taps being turned on, the shower. Worst still, this hotel does attract those who like to stay out very late so expect to be rudely awaken by druken revellers talking in corridors and trying to get back into their rooms. Sound travels extremely well in this hotel. For someone who likes a good nights sleep this hotel is not for me.

Reviews.Title: “small confort rooms”
Reviews.Author: JHAD
Reviews.Content: I booked 3 confort rooms but felt that the twin bedded room was the only one with space. The other 2 were double bedded rooms and were extremely small but I asked at reception and we were assured all were confort rooms Which we paid extra for, But over all the location staff and food were good regards June

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for weekend breaks”
Reviews.Author: TiggerSheffield
Reviews.Content: After landing late at night at Girona, We got the late bus into the bus station in Barcelona, this takes about 45 mins. We then got a taxi to the hotel for a couple of euros. The hotel reception is being re-done so the reception was a small desk, how ever we were greeted by friendly staff and got our room no problems, The room was clean, new, and very satisfactor, We didn't have a view but that didn't bother us as there was so much to see outside the hotel. The hotel is more or less central, 5 mins to the port and to the main La Rambles strip. The breakfast was so nice! Continental but evereything you could think of and as much as you like. Would definatly reccomend this hotel and go myself again. We paid about £20 per night for the room, definatly worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: stokepete
Reviews.Content: Excellent budget hotel, good location, friendly staff despite the temporary reception desk, good breakfast with ample choice even for a fussy person like me. If you want a cheap hotel in a good location this is the place to come! I would have no problems reccomending this hotel to anybody - dont expect a fantastic 5 star hotel and you wont be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: notbob-7
Reviews.Content: If you are just after a place to sleep at the cheaper end of Hotels in Barcelona, this is a great location. Just around the corner from the train station that links to the airport (is end of the line) made arriving and departing on first visit to the city so easy. Also, is an easy walk into the old town, marina and other places.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: zuc82
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Oasis Hotel with 3 friends in March 2006. The location of the hotel is superb, right on the edge of the Barrio Gotic, and just across the street from the marina. It's a 10 minute walk to La Rambla and the same to the beach. Metro and bus lines are very close to the hotel, the Metro is so easy to use I can't describe it to you! The hotel was clean and comfortable. Rooms were a decent size and secure. Bathroom was immaculate and the beds were comfortable. Buffet breakfast was excellent and there was plenty to choose from. The staff spoke English and were very friendly and organised; we had tickets to a BArca game delivered to the hotel and they were there at reception waiting for us when we arrived. I highly recommend this hotel and challenge anyone to pick faults with it. The next time we go, we will be staying here without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Mallejha
Reviews.Content: We arrived late at night at Girona Airport in November. we took the bus to barcelona station. a taxi cost us 10euros, which we knew was a rip off but were too tired to argue!! we were greeted at the temporary reception by two very polite and helpful gentlemen who spoke very good english. the next day the receptionist took great delight in offering advice when we asked for directions and as a result we hadsome amazing experiences we would not have known about otherwise!! the room was clean and comfy. we had a top floor room and the view was wonderful from the window! the staff at breakfast were pleasant and always helpful. we spent most of our time out of the hotel obviously!! there was an irish bar round thecorner from the hotel and the marina was a few minutes walk away. the metro was just at the end of the street and the beach was only 5 minues away. fantastic location, wonderful staff. i am already planning our next visit! Although be warned, this is not a 4star hotel, do not expect Hilton standards!! if you are looking for a comfortable, well appointed hotel for a short break this is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: perryScotland
Reviews.Content: We loved the location of this hotel. We took a taxi from the airport as we were not sure where we were going and it cost about 30euros but we found the train station just around the corner so we found out it would cost about 5euros when we were going back. A basic hotel but very clean and friendly staff. The breakfast was very good, you could eat as much as you liked. We will definately go back to the Oasis.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis confort-excellent location”
Reviews.Author: fandabidoze
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Confort rooms in this Hotel on a weekend break. It was very clean and the breakfast was fine. There was some refurbishment going on so there was only a makeshift reception, however despite that the receptionist was very friendly and effiicient. The Barceloneta metro was just around the corner and the tourist bus (blue Line) stopped across the square from the hotel. You are just walking distance from Port Vale and the marina. Only comment I have about our room was that it was just above the main door and the sound of traffic was very noisy. I would ask to move if allocated a room first floor at the front.

Reviews.Title: “should be a three star!!”
Reviews.Author: ERIN84
Reviews.Content: This hotel was alot better than an average 2 star hotel. I went with my friend and am usually quite fussy when it comes to places to stay but i loved it. It was not dirty at all and the location was fab. If you are going for a fun weekend in Barcelona, stay at the Oasis!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Bish40
Reviews.Content: We have just returned after spending 4 nights at the Oasis. We booked a confort room and we wern't disappointed. The room was clean and spacious with 3 single beds a telly and plenty of closet space. The bathroom was adequate and shower was ok although the bath was a tad small, but who has time for a bath on a city break. The breakfast was buffet style with plenty of choice, but anyone wanting a full english should book elsewhere. The dining room is quite small and busy but we never had to wait for a table, more through luck than judgement. The staff are friendly but dont speak much english, but why should they, they're Spanish. We had to call reception after our key card conked out but this was dealt with straight away without any fuss, although we hadnt a clue what the maintanence man was saying. The location was a major factor in us choosing the Oasis as well as the price. Its approx. 10-15 mins walk down the prom. from la Rambles. We didnt spend that much time in the hotel and its not the best looking from the outside, but if your on a budget and want an ideal location this hotel is for you. I would have no hesitation recomending this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: KentUKRascal
Reviews.Content: Hotel was far better than it's star rating would suggest. Our room was clean and well presented. The staff were helpfull and above all looked cheerful. Breakfast was adequate for our needs.When combined with the location close to the 'centre of things' this is an hotel that I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value brillian location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Oasis on numerous ocassions. Every time we have stayed here we have never had a bad experience. check in has always been easy, the staff more than helpful. the breakfast is what you expect for the price you pay. The rooms have always been clean. Would recommend this hotel to anyone who really wants to enjoy what Barcelona has to offer. Lets be real this city has so much and who wants to stay in their room when there's so much to see and do. The location of this hotel is superb and the ramblas just a short walk away and the port on your doorstep. STAY HERE YOU WILL NOT REGRET IT IT IS REAL VALUE FOR MONEY.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for a couple of nights”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Don't expect the Ritz and you won't be disappointed. Considering the location (which is excellent) in comparison to the price, its not surprising the Oasis lacks somewhat in luxuries. The rooms are small, the bath is tiny and the balcony is more like a ledge but they are clean and fine for a couple of nights if you are not planning on spending much time there during the day. The male receptionist is fantastic and the staff very helpful. Breakfast was very good and the hotel bar very nice with reasonable prices. I would certainly recommend it for a budget city break.

Reviews.Title: “spot on reviews”
Reviews.Author: brianheyes1
Reviews.Content: Just read last few reviews on this page and all were spot on with my experience. ie;- small rooms (confort booked up), heaters not very hot. But all in all a great location so dont expect 5 star and you will enjoy your stay

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Budget Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you want a cheap but clean hotel room in a fantastic location - this will be perfect for you. Dont make the mistake of expecting all the trimmings that go with a 5* hotel and you wont be disappointed. Rooms are very basic yet comfortable and clean - enough for you to get a decent nights kip. Breakfasts are simple and filling. Location is ideal with the main attractions including the Ramblas only 10 mins walk away. Tube and bus stations only a 1 minute walk away. Would recommend to anyone wishing for a good comfortable base to see Barcelona from on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “great value for money”
Reviews.Author: delacourt
Reviews.Content: Don't forget this is only a two star hotel. We had a standard room which was on the small side but everything was clean and tidy. The beds were very comfortable and the bathroom had no mould or damp problem even though there was no extractor fan. You can't fault the location of this hotel..just minutes from alot of attractions or close to transport stops. If you want a full english for breakfast you will be disappointed, but we enjoyed the cold buffet. I wouldn't recommend thid hotel for a romantic weekend but if you are looking for a place to crash in between sightseeing and partying this is well worth staying at.

Reviews.Title: “IT IS NOT DISGUSTING!”
Reviews.Author: MelissaRoughley
Reviews.Content: I was worried about staying here due to a couple of scary reviews! However, although it wasn't great it certainly wasn't disgusting! We wanted a confort room but these were all booked up, even the corridors to the confort rooms were nicer than the standard room corridors! The triple standard room was poky and the view was very disappointing to say the least! However the room was very clean and this is important! The breakfast was rubbish - much preferable to go to a nearby local pastry/coffee shop. The location was good and the staff helpful. So, if you are thinking of booking, definitely get a confort room, if you have booked and couldn't get one, don't worry, it is not disgusting, but don't expect the Ritz!

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A double 'confort' room at the Hotel Oasis, Barcelona, was good value, clean and extremely well positioned for a short break in the city. Breakfast was adequate and sufficiently filling to make lunch a cheap option. Visit the Cathedrals, Olympic Village and the Nou Camp. If you want to watch a match the Champions League fixture cost 29 euros for a real Bird's Eye view. If you can't stand heights then it does get more expensive. Try not to take a car into the City. Traffic is usually congested and the Metro and Tourist buses offer a reasonable alternative for a small cost. If you don't want to use your car it will cost at least 19 euros per day for off street parking (and possibly more). If I go back I may well use the Oasis again but will not be taking a car!

Reviews.Title: “Could not fault it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Oasis in Barcelona for two nights in October. We had a triple room on the fifth floor, the room was spacious, very clean and quiet. The staff were helpful and pleasant, the breakfast room was also clean and the breakfast for a 2* hotel was very good. The location of the hotel was perfect, the tour buses stopped just down the road, it was an easy walk along by the marina to the statue of Christopher Columbus (about 10 min) and from there straight up the Ramblas. We had an excellent stay and would certainly stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Something positive!”
Reviews.Author: Twig38
Reviews.Content: My sister and I booked this hotel through Easyjet and only read the past reviews in the weeks before we left. So it was with much trepidation that we entered the hotel on 20/10/05 for our three night stay. The entrance and reception are of a high standard and we were served by a very polite and friendly receptionist. Luckily we had been allocated a "confort" room and have no complaints whatsoever. It was spacious, clean and all that we needed for our stay. All the staff we came into contact with were polite and friendly. I had used a folded blanket as I need more than one pillow and the next day the chambermaid must have figured I needed a second one and had provided one without my even asking, i think that is great service. It is in a fantastic location close to Metro, train and the tourist buses (highly recommended for seeing the city). It's a city that never sleeps so there is constant traffic noise and sirens but only to be expected in a city centre hotel, we found the windows were sufficient to dull the noise and we slept very well. I think as long as you ensure you get a confort room you will not be disappointed with this hotel. It was our first trip to Barcelona and we fell in love with the city, highly recommended you go there and give The Oasis a go!

Reviews.Title: “please don`t go there!!! It is disgusting”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night. It is the worst hotel (if you could call it like this, it is worse than a hostel) that i have ever been. The room that we got had almost no natural light and it was extremely dirty. If you are claustrophobic it would be a problem, because the room was a matchbox (max 8 m2). The smell in the room was also terrible, a mixture of fried food and cigarette smell and the staff was very unfriendly. The breakfast was simple and not good, i would not recomend, you better eat anywhere else. The next day we leaved the hotel and found an one star hotel just around the corner that was half of the price and much better. WARNING: do not book a room in Oasis!!!

Reviews.Title: “No Problems”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: just back from a brilliant short break staying at hotel oasis. Have to admit about being a bit worried about previous posts, but if you've already booked, and are now panicing- please don't. we were in a superior room, which was clean and spacious. The staff were always friendly and the location really fantastic - 5 mins to zoo, 5 mins to marina area with aquarium and IMAX and 10 min walk to La Rambla. There are also 2 very close stops for the open top bus tour. Breakfast was nice- plenty of choice and in ample supply. Well above average for a 2 star hotel. Would gladly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “YUK!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We are an Italian family of 4 and we booked for this hotel using Alpitour in Italy.Well, when we arrived there and got into the room we saw a huge black bug crossing the room.I was horrified and we obviously called the tour operator in Italy that understood the situation and let us change the hotel.That would certainly have ruined our holiday...Keep out of this horrible hotel

Reviews.Title: “We were robbed inside the room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: BE VERY CAREFUL!!WE WERE ROBBED JUST ARRIVED. In the morning of the first day we were at hotel oasis, we realized that our money,left in the suitcase inside our room, was disappeared. IT WAS 570 EUROS!!!!! We told the fact to the receptionist and to his principal but they didn't do nothing and said that we were culpable of leaving the money in the room...Incredible!!!Going out all the people gave the magnetic card of their room to the recepstionist and trusts him; besides us who could enter in the room with magnetic card??? Try to give an answer.....

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful.”
Reviews.Author: CAG1
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in the Oasis hotel in June. A basic hotel that was fairly clean. Rooms were pretty small and really needed redecorating, but were adequate for a place to stay. The breakfast was simple, but enough to set you on your way. Looks as if they are refurbishing the hotel and I am sure that once complete, this hotel will be easily worthy of a 3 star rating. It was well placed - just a five minute walk from the beach, the Harbour and about 10 minutes to La Ramblas. Barcelona was a great place to visit. saw everything the two of us needed to in the time we were there and really enjoyed our stay. enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner recently stayed in the Hotel on a four night break in July. We found the location to be great with the beach only a 5 minute walk away and the Las Ramblas area really close as well - about 5-10 minute walk, didn't need a taxi the whole time we were there. We were a bit concerned after reading some of the other reviews about this Hotel but we were in a comfort room which was brand new and clean, the room had air-con, and was also very quiet. The breakfast was also good and staff were helpful. Would definitely recommend this Hotel and stay here again as for the price and location you won't get any better.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: Susan_W78
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights over the first weekend in July. Three of us shared a triple room and paid £50 each for 2 nights B&B. After reading the reviews on this site, it would appear that soime of the hotel rooms are refurbished and some arent - ours wasn't. The room was small and basic, but the bed linen, towels, bath and sink were clean. The bathroom floor looked clean but had a squashed cockroach in the corner so obviously hadn't been mopped. The beds were comfortable, the TV worked, if you could be bothered the fiddle on with it, and the air con worked, although it did make a buzzing sound every now and again. Breakfast was ok - toast, bread rolls, croissants, ham, salami, cheese, cornflakes, fruit and yogurt - and the breakfast area and bar are nicely decorated and clean. The staff on reception are polite enough but not very helpful and a couple ofthem spoke poor english. All in all this hotel was ok - for £25 a night I couldn't complain. If all you're after is somewhere to sleep with a shower that works, then this is the place. If you want anything more than that, don't bother staying here.

Reviews.Title: “At least the location is good!”
Reviews.Author: EmiratesGirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Oasis for 4 nights. I agree with the previous reviewer about Octopus Travel - they provide very flattering photos of this hotel. The hotel was being refurbished but we were given an old room which was filthy and worn. The hotel staff said the refurbished rooms were all booked even though we booked the hotel 5 months previous and never saw more than half a dozen other guests in the hotel. The room had the smallest window I've ever seen (with a view of the neighbouring wall), we had the opposite problem with the radiator in the fact that it wouldn't turn off, so the heat in the room was unbearable! (Don't expect air conditioning) Our room was next to the elavator - the noise of the elavator throughout the night was like a pneumatic drill in the head, then the cleaners started hoovering at around 6.30am. Nice. The hotel staff were completely uninterested in any problems - we even spoke to the hotel manager who told us to contact Octopus Travel as he held no responsibility (!), and when we contacted Octopus Travel, guess what - we were told to complain to the hotel manager. A filthy hell-hole, I would pay a lot extra to stay at a better hotel next time, as Barcelona is a great city. The location's not bad though.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable City Break”
Reviews.Author: TWOWILLS
Reviews.Content: We spent a four day city break, Mon 2nd till Thurs 5th May and stayed at the Oasis Hotel. After reading two of the previous reviews for April I was very worried about this booking as my 70 year old (though fairly fit) sister was accompanying my husband and myself. However we were pleasantly surprised when we got to our rooms. Our double room (third floor) was quite small but very clean and comfortable with air con (which did work if you tried) TV, phone, nice bathroom with hair dryer and large make up mirror, soap, shampoo. Plenty of clean white towels. Our bed was clean and comfortable. My sister was on the floor below and her twin room was larger and she had absolutely no complaints considering what we had paid for the trip. We had been informed that there was an ongoing refurbishment programme and the lift would not be in use. However the service lift would be in operation, hence my sister being on a lower floor. Our rooms were the Superior or Comfort rooms and had obviously been newly refurbished. Not sure if the intention is to refurbish and upgrade all the hotel rooms. I think it would be a good idea as the only complaint we had was that there was no safety deposit box ( we left our money and passports in the Reception safe) and we would have liked a brighter bedside lamp for reading at night. Breakfast was the usual continental type breakfast which we thought was adequate and there was also a tapas/bar and restuarant. We ate out but did have a couple of drinks each night in the bar. This hotel is only about a ten minute stroll from La Ramblas and lots of other attractions and right next door to the metro. The railway station is also round the corner though we didn't realise this till later and took a taxi from the airport. About 23 euros, so split three ways was far easier way to get direct to your hotel. Walls probably are quite thin but I think this is the same in most 2/3 star hotels, certainly the ones we have stayed in in Paris and Amsterdam. The only noise we heard was the cleaner in the morning which we didn't have a problem with as it was about time to get up anyway and also the noise of running water from toilet and showers above and below. First morning I did think it was water running down the wall but after that didn't really notice it. All in all we had a wonderful break with lovely warm weather. For a 2 star hotel we were very happy with the standard and location of the hotel. All the staff were fine and tried to be helpful. We would have no hestitation in staying at the Oasis again if/when we go back to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Not Awful - would definately stay again”
Reviews.Author: heather92282
Reviews.Content: This hotel definately isn't the nicest hotel we came across while visiting Barcelona, but was far from the worst. It seemed that we either came across REALLY nice hotels (which were also very expensive) or REALLY gross hotels (which were really cheap) - Hotel Oasis was one of the only hotels we came across which was somewhere in the middle. It was perfect for my friend and I who did not want to spend a fortune on a room but wanted it to be at least decent. You get a good price for the area, with an incredible location, right next to a metro, 5 minute walk from the beach, perfect distance from las ramblas... The breakfast buffet they have was okay - nothing special though. The rooms were pretty tiny but clean. Just a warning - they are in the process of doing a lot of work on the hotel now - so there is a lot of contruction going on - but it did not really bother us. If you plan to be in the room during the day and like quiet - you may want to keep this in mind. One more thing to note - the room with a balcony isnt really a balcony - we had trouble getting the window open to be honest. The one thing we really were not happy about, was that our phone had been torn out of the wall and was just sitting on the nightstand broken. We asked several times for this to be fixed and nothing was ever done about it. Our wake up call in the morning became a wake up pound on the door. When we went downstairs to ask to use their phone at one point to make a local call - we were told no. We were pretty angry about that... Overall, I would stay here again. For someone who doesn't want to spend a fortune on a room, but is not up to braving a hostel - this hotel is a good choice. You aren't going to get the top of the line service, but you don't pay for it either.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here - it's awful”
Reviews.Author: youngsterdave76
Reviews.Content: What a disappointment. Paid over the odds for a tiny, unclean room. Bath was tiny, bathroom needed a good scrub. Room was only big enough for the bed and not much else. We had a room on the second floor, slightly noisy but hotel was empty when we stayed - I'd dread to thinkl what it would be like if the hotel was full! Breakfast was a joke, staff reasonable. You can get nice 4* hotels for teh same price we paid for this hell-hole.

Reviews.Title: “noisy, scruffy, unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 sleepless nights in Oasis, It will be the last! Very very noicy!! all floors, including hallways, are tiled! so that every footstep is amplified throughout the building. No sound proofing between walls so that you can hear every sound at night, toilet flushing, showering + t.v noice. This hotel is ideal for people who are heavy sleepers, drunk till unconsiousness,or people who require little or no sleep at all! A word of warning! beware of pick-pockets, shifty barmen and rip-off taxi-drivers! They all operate arround Barcelona with the same aim, TO RIP OFF THE TOURIST!! I was unfornunate to meet all three!

Reviews.Title: “great value ,good position”
Reviews.Author: steamboatglossop
Reviews.Content: just returned from oasis and we feel it is ideal for a short break and great value ,we booked through easy jet and the whole trip worked fantastically. Oasis is by the harbour(2mins)on the tourist bus route (a must) and a nice 5-10 minute stroll to the ramblas along the seafront The staff are really helpfull. Our room was very clean,very well looked after and the bathroom was lovely. The only downside was the continental breakfast but that has been the same wherever we have stayed! I would definately use the oasis again
